subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Review charts for Shavian Quikscript Extensions
msgSnippet: Thanks, it s good to have that clear.
messageBody:
Thanks, it's good to have that clear.

Ph. D. wrote:
>
> amd64_hacker skribis:
> >
> > I can't find where Kingsley Read lays out the
> > rules for Shavian, the best I can say is that I
> > have seen joined up Shavian 'in the wild'. Does
> > anyone on the list have a link to some author-
> > itative documentation for Shavian?
>
> At the end of the Shaw alphabet edition of the
> book _Androcles and the Lion_, there is a
> section titled "Suggestions for Writing" authored
> by Read. Among other things, it says:
>
> "Leave ample space between words. Write the
> letters of each word closely together. Avoid
> linking letters unnaturally.
> "There is no need to link letters at all. But it
> frequently happens that the end of one letter
> naturally runs into the beginning of another, and
> the alphabet is so designed that this cannot
> produce alternative readings.
> "Junctions or links can occur only along one of
> the double guide-lines (used or imagined) within
> which Short letters are written. No links are
> permissible between the guide-lines, nor above
> them, nor beneath them.
> "Fast writers are likely to make such natural
> junctions as these:
> <illustration shown>
> -- in which it is easy to recognize these separate
> letters, and no others:
> <illustration shown> "
>
> The illustrations can be seen here:
> http://www.phillipdriscoll.com/shawscan2.jpg
> <http://www.phillipdriscoll.com/shawscan2.jpg>
>
> --Ph. D.
>
>
